Description: Black basalt anthropoid sarcophagus; three columns of Hieroglyphic text on the lid.
Curator's comments: Published: Wiese, Antikenmuseum Basel und Sammlung Ludwig Die Agyptische Abteilung (2001): No.140

See: A. J. Spencer, 'Observations on Some Egyptian Sarcophagi in the British Museum', in W. V. Davies (ed), Studies in Egyptian Antiquities: A Tribute to T. G. H. James (BM Occasional Paper 123, 1999), 13-21.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001-2014, Basel, Switzerland, Antikenmuseum. Long term loan. 2015 July - September, Tokyo, National Museum, Queens of Egypt 2015 October - December, Osaka, National Museum of Art, Queens of Egypt 2021 - 2022 27 Apr – 16 Jan, Madrid, Caixa Forum, “Human Image” 2022 16 Feb – 29 May, Seville, Caixa Forum, “Human Image” 2022 28 Jun - 9 Oct, Zaragoza, Caixa Forum, “Human Image” 2022 -2023 22 Nov - 9 Apr, Palma, Caixa Forum, “Human Image” 2023 4 July - 22 Oct, Barcelona, Caixa Forum, “Human Image”
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr Alexander Turnbull Christie (Acquired on 27 January 1832 in Alexandria from 'Yanni the Greek' (Giovanni d’Athanasi). The passage of Turnbull Christie's diary recorded in the correspondance mentions ‘a beautiful and very perfect sarcophagus of a priest in basalt from Memphis’. The price asked was $200 (Correspondence 1826-1860, vol. 3 [CA-CL], 1033).)
